page.title: 07Industries in Malmesbury #2
page.content: {Linolite}was formed by{Alfred {William Beutell.}It is really two companies, Linolite and{Rotaflex Home {Lighting.}The firm was originally in London, but moved to Malmesbury in 1941. It has recently built a new large factory on the outskirts of the town _ this is due to open before the end of 1985. At the present time the company employs{270 people. {Lux Traffic Controls}has been in Malmesbury for fifteen years. It was started by{George Lux}who still owns the company. The firm has recently moved into some new offices in the Old Station Yard. The Company's job is to set up traffic lights where the roads have been dug up, and the control of the traffic is necessary.{38 people work for the company at the present time.
